sidereal (of or relating to the stars)

𒅄 𒋲·𒆳 𒇹²·𒍝²·𒆳 ĝeštae Gestirn 𒄑 cis "cyprus" ≈ 𒆜

𓌕 aster 𓊃𓈙𓂋𓌕 ˢtîr 𒋾 𓄝 Strahl australis 𓇾 𓐮 𓏏 𓇿 𓈉 ⇔ Ta-Seti shooting stars

𒀭𒊹 ≈ 𒐀𒁹𒎗 Aššur 𒀸𒋩 Ashur

Stars and planets = cows and sheep
In the religious text Nanna-Suen Hymn 1 (Sumerian period, 3rd-millennium BCE), cows are an allusion to the stars in the night sky.

стъалы st’aly

𓋴 𓃀 𓇼 𓏤 | star | •CCB 𐩫𐩥𐩫𐩨 kwkb ኮከብ kokäb old "cis" reading

𒀭𒅗𒁲𒈾𒋫 Ištaran

• Arabic ءَثْتَرْ (ʿaṯtar) : Hebrew עַשְׁתֹּרֶת (‘aštōreṯ) [Goddess Innana, Venus] with Sanskrit स्तृ (str̥) : Avestan 𐬀𐬯𐬙𐬀𐬭 (astar) [Star] (compare : Armenian աստղ առաւաւտին (astł aṙawawtin) [star-morning ; Venus])

𒀯𒀭 mul-an mulan heavenly star

𒋼𒅆𒃻𒋦𒈧 MUL₂-IGI-ša₂-SUḪUR-MAŠ₂ γ Capricorni 𒄱𒋼𒄱𒃻𒋦𒈧 MUL₂-ar₂-ša₂-SUḪUR-MAŠ₂ δ Capricorni 𒋼𒋼 MUL₂-MUL₂ η Tauri @ Pleiades 𒀯𒀯 𒅖? is⸣-le₁₀ α Tauri “Follower” 𓋴 𓃀 𓄿 𓇼 𓇳 𓌞 𒍑 UŠ 𒋩𒇀𒃻𒋛 ŠUR-GIGIR-ša₂-SI β Tauri "Horn" 𒋩𒇀𒃻𒍇 ŠUR-GIGIR-ša₂-ULU₃ ζ Tauri ≈ Sauru "southern" 天關 Tiānguān 𒅆?𒃻𒀳 ⸢IGI SA₄⸣-ša₂-ABSIN α Virginis 𓍁 1/𓌻 𒄊𒄱𒃻𒌨𒀀 GIR₃-ar₂-ša₂-UR.A β Virginis ⇔ "Lion's Foot"
𒀸𒃻𒅆𒀳 DELE-ša₂-IGI-ABSIN γ Virginis ⇔ Venus 𒀸𒍗
𒈗 LUGALᵘˢ α Leonis Regulus @ 𒌨𒄖𒆷 UR.GU.LA 𒊕𒌨𒀀 SAG-UR.A ε Leonis "Lion's Head" 𒄑𒆲𒀀 GIŠ.KUN-A ϑ Leonis <> β Denebola 𒆲 "Tail" 𒋼𒌉𒃻𒐼 MUL₂-TUR-ša₂-4-… ρ Leonis "4 kids?" 𒌑𒄱𒈗 KUŠ₃-ar₂-LUGAL ρ Leonis 𒂟 𒃻𒍇 RIN₂-ša₂-ULU₃ α Librae ≠ Tauri 𒂟𒃻𒋛 RIN₂-ša₂-SI β Librae 𒆭 KU₄/SI₄ α Scorpii 𒋼𒆳𒃻𒄙𒉡𒉡 MUL₂-KUR-ša₂-DUR-nu-nu η Piscium Kullat Nunu “cord of fish” 𒋼𒆳𒃻𒅗𒋻𒈭𒉺 MUL₂-KUR-ša₂-KIR₄-šil-taḫ-PA ϑ Ophiuchi (only one) 𒋼𒂊𒃻𒊕𒄈𒋰 MUL₂-E-ša₂-SAG-GIR₂.TAB β Scorpii
𒋼𒉠𒃻𒊕𒄈𒋰 MUL₂-MURUB₄-ša₂-SAG-GIR₂.TAB δ Scorpii 𒈦𒈦𒅆 MAŠ.MAŠ.IGI α Geminorum
𒈦𒈦𒄱 MAŠ.MAŠ.MUL₂ β Geminorum 𒈦𒈦𒃻𒉺𒇻 MAŠ.MAŠ-ša₂-SIPA γ Geminorum 𒋼𒅆𒄱𒃻𒊺𒂍𒈦𒈦 MUL₂-igi-ša₂-ŠE-PIT₂maš.maš η Geminorum <> SIPAD 𒉺𒁳 𒂙(𒂘)? 𒄱𒋼𒄱𒃻𒊺𒂍?𒈦𒈦 MUL₂-ar₂-ša₂-ŠE-PIT-maš.maš μ Geminorum <> 𒀉 biṭ? 𒋼𒄱𒃻𒉄𒃻𒋛 MUL₂-IGI-ša₂-ALLA-ša₂-SI γ Cancri 𒋼𒄱𒃻𒉄𒃻𒍇 MUL₂-ar₂-ša₂-ALLA-ša₂-ULU₃ δ Cancri ^^ 𒋼𒅆𒃻𒉄𒃻𒍇 MUL₂-IGI-ša₂-ALLA-ša₂-ULU₃ ϑ Cancri 𓋴 𓃀 𓇼 Spica @ Virgo latin spike “Ähre, ear” <> 𒊺

Star ≈ sidereal ≈ Sa‘d al- "Lucky Star of…" Homam ζ Pegasi "سعد الهمايم" (Sa‘d al-Humām) "Lucky Star of the Hero" Biham θ Pegasi "سعد البهائم" (Sa‘d al-Bihām) "Lucky Star of the Young Beasts." Sadalbari μ Pegasi "سعد البرع" (Sa‘d al-Birā‘) "Luck of the innocents." all at Pegasus saddle though!

Markab α Pegasi "المرقب" al-Mirqab "saddle" mare cab אֻכָּף אוכף ukaf cover ኮር kor

Kochab (β UMi) al-Kawkab "Star" (Teil von Ursa Minor) Yildun (δ UMi): türkisch "Yıldız" "Stern" Il Don = AN
